Ahmadi requested a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He is hoping that TLM will approve his loan application shortly.

loans.use: to buy products used daily such as instant noodles, snacks and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mijgona

texts.en:
Mijgona is not married and has no children. She lives with her parents. There are eight members in her family. She always wanted to live in good conditions but Mijgona and her family live poorly as all members of the family have a small income. 

Mijgona decided to start new sewing business as she is a wonderful sewer. She heard about a course ‘To get ahead’ provided by a women's organization and was very happy because she has a good opportunity to set-up her business after studying on this course. She got enough business skills. She is asking for a loan of 2,800 Somoni to buy a sewing machine and an iron to set up her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and an iron for her new sewing business.

loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en: Marichelle is 31 years old and is separated with 1 child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a copra production business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 4 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase materials for copra. In the future, she wants to make improvements in her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for copra production.

loans.name: Alvaro Jose

texts.es: Álvaro José 52 años de edad casado, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, el cual se caracteriza por ser una zona muy productiva en el comercio, Álvaro es una persona responsable, honesta, trabajador y con muchas ganas de superación personal, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo terminar sus estudios terminando solo la secundaria pero él nos dice que le gustaría haber estudiado una carrera, gracias a su espíritu emprendedor la logrado ser dueño de Un Cyber donde brinda los servicios de levantado de Textos, escaneo, impresiones en blanco y negro, servicios de fax, respaldo de CD, fotocopias, servicio de internet entre otros, también tiene el alquiler de y venta de películas familiares, de niños para sus clientes puedan disfrutar en familia, tiene clientes fijos, eventuales y nuevos,  Álvaro disfruta mucho de trabajo  de ver las caras de sus clientes cuando busca algo y él se los puede ofrecer, los  productos que ofrece son de calidad, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su equipo de trabajo y terminar de construir su casa. Él está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo como en la compra de Impresora y fotocopiadora y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Álvaro José is 52 years old, married, and originally from the city of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  Alvaro is a responsible, honest, hardworking man with a great desire for personal success.  He was not able to complete his secondary school education due to a lack of financial resources, but he says that he would like to study for a career.  Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit, he was able to become the owner of a cyber café, where he provides text services, scanning, black and white copying, FAX service, CD reproductions, internet services, and other things.  He also rents family movies for children so that his customers can enjoy their families.  He has steady customers, old and new.

Alvaro likes his job very much and to see the faces of his customers when they look for things that he is able to offer them.  His products are of good quality and one of his dreams is to be able to improve his work equipment and complete the building of his house.  He is asking for this loan so he can buy things like a printer and photocopier and be able to provide better service to his customers and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a printer and photocopier.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a single mother of two children. She lives in a family house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a cafe business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market.

With the requested 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Mr. Akbar Ali is a milk-seller by profession. For the past 20 years, he has been selling fresh, delicious and pure milk in the market which he gets from his buffaloes. He is a father of three children and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He loves his family and he does a lot of hard work to fulfill the needs of his family. 

Presently he wants to purchase one more buffalo so his business can grow. He hopes that the loan will be productive one for his business. 

The house in that Mr. Akbar and his family live is in substandard condition and he needs to repair his house as soon as possible. So he will use the profit amount for the construction of his house. He wants to provide higher education to his children. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo to have more milk to sell.

loans.name: Flor De Amapolas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE AMAPOLAS”  iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Angélica es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de colchones, venta de camas, venta de api, venta de dulces y frutas, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Angélica es integrante, ella indica que hace quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pan; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, quien anteriormente vendía este producto y posteriormente decide emprenderlo ella.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las empresas de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía se encuentra acompañando al grupo la hija de una socia, ella esta vestida de chompa negra y pantalos rojo.
texts.en:
The FLOR DE AMAPOLAS communal bank will begin its 14th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada center.  It’s made up of eight ladies and directed by a board of directors where Angelica serves as the secretary.  The members have various businesses, such as clothing sales, mattress sales, bed sales, api (non-alcoholic maize drink) sales, candy and fruit sales, vegetable sales, and neighborhood stores.

This loan will help their small businesses, of which Angelica is a part.  She has been with Pro Mujer for 15 years, having joined on the invitation of a friend who was part of the institution.  [Angelica] has a bread business and learned this from her mother, who use to sell this product and [Angelica] later decided to do this as well.

This loan is so that she can buy flour in bulk from the companies in El Alto.  She will later make bread and sell it in her stall.  This work will allow her to generate income in order to maintain what she needs in her home, as she is in a common law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health care.  One of the member’s daughters is shown in the photograph.  [Angelica] is wearing a black sweater and red pants.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Yaqoob

texts.en:
Mr. Yaqoob is a 53-year-old hardworking man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His family consists of 7 daughters and his wife. He has been running a sanitary and electrical goods shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for the family. 

He has requested the loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase water pipes, pvc pipes, sockets, elbows, joints, switches, and cables to sell. He hopes that he will get a good amount of profit with the help of this loan amount.

With the profit he wants to save capital for the marriages of his daughters. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of pipes, sockets, elbows, joints, switches, and cables to sell.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a business selling soft drink fruit juices. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and high cost of transporting raw materials. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits to make fruit juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits to make fruit juice to sell.

loans.name: Hanzal

texts.en:
Hanzal is a 28-year-old single man, who has been working in his convenience store since 2000. His store is necessary in his village since they don't have malls or larger stores.

He has a very good reputation, he works hard to preserve it as much as he can. He has a good repayment history as an Al Majmoua borrower for four consecutive cycles. Hanzal has a good chance to expand his future loans a lot.

Hanzal is benefiting from this opportunity to expand his business through increasing his merchandise by applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. This loan will help him provide his customers with special spring and summer beverages.

Hanzal is a hard worker, he is still planning to expand his business more and more into the wholesale trade in the future. In the meantime he is concentrating on expanding and increasing his present store's capital and income.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has one child, who attends school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs.

Amina has operated a seat-hiring business for the past five years; her neighbours and people holding functions are her potential clients. In addition she also operates a business selling food stuff which brings her an additional source of livelihood. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase more seats to hire to meet her customers' demand. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seats to hire out to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Vehbi

texts.en:
Vehbi, 58 is an enterprising person, ambitious and serious, who lives with his wife and four children in the village in the northern part of Kosovo. He works in the agriculture business selling milk and corn. 
Vehbi needs the loan in order to buy corn for planting and guano. With the loan he hopes that the sales in his business will increase since he will have more corn to offer to his customers and to cover their necessities.

He hopes to improve his economic situation, to continue planting corn for selling and to add more milk cows.  Vehbi hopes this will enable him to continue supporting his family, and for his children to become educated people with principles and values.

loans.use: To buy corn for planting and guano

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
For the past years, Rachael has operated a food vending business with the help of the previous Kiva loan, selling at the market to market dwellers and passersby. Racheal cites seasonality to be her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she thanks Yehu and Kiva for their help.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, rice, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 27-year-old single woman, who has been working selling clothes since 2009. Huda is willing to start her own business from the beginning in parallel with her present job as a sales person in a clothes selling shop, until she finds herself ready to open her own shop in the future.
Huda is well known in her region with her special customer care and smile that never leaves her face. She is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to start her own clothes selling business from home, as an extra income business, and will use part of it for consumption needs. 
Huda is a hard worker who believes that when there is a will there is a way, and for her Al Majmoua is the way which she's optimistic to start with.

loans.use: to start her own clothing sales business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Halima dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.name: Dieu Pourvoira 1 Group

texts.en:
Olivia, age 32, is single with no children. She represents the Dieu Pourvoira 1 group. Olivia has a small business where she sells phone cards and phone credit. She has been operating this business for one year. She will use the loan to buy more phone cards and credit from cell phone companies. In Congo, the majority of cell phones are not on contract. Instead, people buy minutes as they need them. The cell phone companies sell their cards and credit to individuals who then sell them to the public. Olivia's business strategy is to sell individual items as well as to sell credit in bulk. Her stand is located on a busy avenue on which many people travel. 

This is Olivia's first loan from HOPE Congo. HOPE Congo and Olivia's group members are confident that she will pay the loan back. In the future, she hopes to be a large distributor of phone cards who sells to smaller businesses.

loans.use: to buy phone cards and credit from cell phone companies to sell

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 54 years old. He lives in Kutaisi district with his daughters (19 and 25 years old). Vazha requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Vazha’s wife is abroad and she is sending transfers to the family. Their additional income is Vazha’s elder daughter’s monthly salary. She is working as a nurse at the local clinic. 

Vazha requested a loan from Credo to start up his family business. Vazha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Vazha will finish renovation work and purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop. He owns a commercial space where small jobs are left to finish renovations. After finishing renovation he will purchase grocery stock and open a grocery shop there. Vazha is very hardworking man and he will work as a seller to decrease the expenses and increase his profit. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to finish renovation work and purchase grocery stock to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is married with two children, both of whom attend school. Her husband is a carpenter and he supports his family financially. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Amina has been operating a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge from other food vendors during the sales season. With her KES 20,000 loan she wants to diversify and start a firewood selling business, purchasing bundles of firewood for resale. Amina dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a married man and a father of four children. He describes himself as a determined person.

Francis operates a business in poultry sales in an urban area. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of feed.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more poultry feed. This is Francis's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bolormaa, 44 years old, lives with her husband and elder son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her younger son is deployed into military training. Bolormaa has been running a clothing retail business since 2009 at an outdoor market. Her husband has been running a taxi service for local people for four consecutive years and accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers and driving them quickly to their destinations. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years due to harsh winters, especially the bombardments of strong storms and freezing frosts. Therefore, Bolormaa is requesting a loan of 6950000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as planks, cement, fiberglass, and foam. Using these materials, they can repair and insulate their house, thus providing comfortable and warm accommodations for the family. More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and thus contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to repair and insulate her house.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is married and has six children, all of whom attend school and are working.  They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also does farming which earns her other source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish for resale

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a single gentleman aged 28. He has been in the motorcycle business for the last two years making a monthly income of KES12,000.

He learned about KADET Ltd. from other motorbike riders who are registered members and have been assisted financially by KADET Ltd.  

Jackson has acquired his first asset loan of KES 75,000 which will assist him in acquiring his own motorcycle. He will use the proceeds to meet his basic needs. He hopes to be able to save up enough to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is married and has five children. She has received schooling through basic level to junior high school but couldn’t continue due to her parents' financial constraints. Beauty deals in the sales of frozen chicken in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which she has done for 10 years now. Her husband is a teacher. Beauty uses her income to help her husband with the basic needs of the home. 

Beauty will use the loan to purchase cartons of chicken in larger quantities and introduce frozen fish to the fishmongers in her community. With the new profits from her expanded business, Beauty plans to save so she can assist her husband to pay for their children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of chicken in larger quantities and introduce frozen fish to the fishmongers in her community.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a business selling fruit juice as retail to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; especially during rainy season the business is low. 

Here she comes again asking for a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase sacks of fruits to make fruit juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the help from Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits to make fruit juice to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Torsu Juliana, a married mother of four, has been a food vendor in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe for the past year. She started her doughnut business when she realized her husband, a farmer, needed extra income and their children's schooling was becoming a problem.

Juliana, who uses her income to feed the family, has requested this loan to purchase bags of flour, a gallon of oil, and sugar to make fried doughnuts to sell in her locality. She plans to use the new profits arising from her expanded business to introduce the sale of other pastries.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, a gallon of oil, and sugar to make fried doughnuts to sell in her locality.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia sells provisions and also operates a drinking spot at Likpe Bakua Township, in Hohoe. Olivia has received education to senior-high school.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a local fashion designer. Olivia has been selling provisions since 2009 to support her husband. She helps her husband to pay their children's school fees and provide food for the family.

Her loan will be used to buy cartons of tinned milk, cartons of soft drinks, crates of minerals, biscuits, candies. She hopes to save the new profits from her expanded business and reinvest them back into the business so she increases her working capital.

loans.use: to buy cartons of tinned milk, cartons of soft drinks, crates of minerals, biscuits and candies.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is married with one child. She has never been to school because she loves trading; hence, she joined her mum to trade. Veronica is a petty trader in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. She has done this work for the past 16 years. Veronica has been into petty trading of various food items since she started her business. Her husband is a farmer. Veronica uses her income to help her husband cover the basic needs of the home. Veronica will use this loan to purchase bags of onions. Veronica plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business into her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of onions

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the KES 20,000 loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Aborgah

texts.en:
Aborgah is a petty trader at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. She has received education only to the primary basic level because her parents did not have the means to support her in school. She is married with 3 children. Her husband is a chainsaw operator. 

Aborgah has been a petty trader since 2010 to support herself. She is responsible for feeding the household. Her loan will be used to purchase ladies' clothing and introduce the sale of children's clothes. She hopes to save and use the new profits from her expanded business to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' clothing and introduce the sale of children's clothes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a married mother of eight, received schooling through to junior high school. Her husband is a farmer, while Agnes has been selling provisions in Likpe Bakua Township, located in Hohoe, for 12 years now, using her income to assist her husband with the basic necessities of the home.

Agnes will use this loan to purchase sachets of Milo plus bathing and washing soap. She plans to put the resulting new profits into savings for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase sachets of Milo plus bathing and washing soap.

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE JULIO”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Graciela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de estuco, lavandera, tejido de polainas y lluchos, hilado de vicuña, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Graciela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de hilado y tejido en lana de vicuña; la técnica la aprende de su madre decide niña, posteriormente cuando ya inicio su familia decide trabajar independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina hiladora) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The 25 DE JULIO communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Juan Pablo center.  It’s made up of seven ladies and directed by a board of directors where Graciela serves as the president.  Their businesses include stucco sales, laundry, knitted leggings, vicuña yarn, and a neighborhood store.

This loan will help their small businesses, including Graciela’s.  This is her first time with Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a promoter who visited her in her home.  She has a yarn and vicuña wool business.  She learned this technique from her mother when she was a little girl and later began working on her own after she started her family.

She will use the money from this loan to buy a threading machine from the fairs in El Alto.  She will later manufacture and sell on order.  This work allows her to earn an income so she can maintain her household.  She is in a common law marriage and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the healthcare.

loans.use: to buy a threading machine.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 36 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with his 35-year-old wife and their two children who are going to school. Artur requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is the monthly salary of Artur’s wife. She is working at the beauty salon as an administrator. The family's total income is so small that they rarely can cover their monthly expenses. 

Artur requested a loan from Credo to start up his family business. Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Artur will purchase a car. He will drive the car as a taxi and earn a daily income. This additional income will help him to improve his family living conditions and provide his children with education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a car to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: G.s Renacer Group

texts.es:
La señora Luisa  de 52  años de edad   vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa de habitación, su actividad es la venta de carnes como ser carne y también  vende lo que es mariscos,  pescado y camarones, se  dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10  años.
Doña Luisa su negocio lo realiza  de lunes a domingo y  sus clientes son las personas de diferentes barrios y colonias de la ciudad y algunas pulperías.
Doña Luisa  sus ventas las realiza de  forma ambulante camina de casa en casa ofreciendo su producto, cada día se levanta las cinco de la mañana para  salir a los diferentes barrios a vender sus productos,  es así como pudo comprar su casa con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo en  su trabajo.
Doña Luisa  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de carnes de res, pollo, cerdo, mariscos, pescados y camarones y al igual que sus compañeros de grupo  espera invertirlo en su  negocios y obtener mejores ganancias que les permitan mejorar sus calidades de vida y las de sus familias.
Doña Vilma se dedica a la venta de pan y tortillas.
Doña Melania se dedica a la venta de baleadas.
Doña Santos se  dedica a la venta de baleadas. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
Luisa is 52 years old and lives with her husband and daughter.  She sells meats, seafood, fish, and shrimp and has been doing this for 10 years.

Luisa works Monday through Sunday and her customers are from different neighborhoods, parts of the city, and also a few stores.

Luisa says that she makes her sales on foot and walks from door to door offering her products daily.  She gets up at 5:00 am every day do go out to the different neighborhoods to sell her products.  This is how she was able to buy her house, with great dedication and effort in her work.

Luisa is asking for a loan to buy beef, chicken, pork, seafood, fish, and shrimp.  Her fellow members also hope to invest in their businesses and improve their earnings and their and their family’s quality of life.

Vilma sells bread and tortillas.

Melinda and Santos each sell baleadas.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 29 años de edad, emprendedora, luchadora y con muchos deseos de superarse. Ella es casada y en compañía de su esposo y su familia se dedican a la actividad de cultivo y producción de café mismo que ha sido por generaciones la actividad practicada en su familia. Sus terrenos son muy apropiados por su frondosidad para los cultivos ya que están ubicados en una zona fértil y limpia de contaminación. Ella ha obtenido y logrado todos sus proyectos gracias a su perseverancia y arduo trabajo, a tal grado que ha obtenido la admiración y apoyo de su compañero de hogar, hijos, amigos y vecinos de dicha Comunidad, también está logrando educar a su hijo quien cursa Educación Primaria. 

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y otros insumos que evitaran que sus cultivos sean dañados por plagas y enfermedades, aprovechando al 100% la cosecha sin daño alguno al producto para su venta.

Su meta es poder ampliar su terreno para poder sembrar y cultivar café ya que su sueño es poder darle a su hijo una mejor educación, un mejor estilo de vida y pueda heredar lo que sus padres con mucho esfuerzo han logrado obtener y pueda darse de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Martha is a 29-year-old woman, enterprising, hard working, and with a lot of desire to get ahead. She is married and with the help of her husband and her family she works in the cultivation and product of coffee. Her family has practiced this activity for generations. Her land is very appropriate for the crops because they are located in a fertile area and free of contamination. She has achieved and completed her projects due to her perseverance and hard work. She works hard to such a degree that her husband, children, friends, and neighbors admire her. She is also working to educate her son who is in primary school.


Currently she is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, manure, and other supplies that will avoid her crops being damaged by diseases. She wants to gain 100% of the crops without damage so she can sell them.

Her goal is to increase her land to be able to seed and harvest coffee. Her dream is to give her son a better education, a better standard of life, and be able to inherit what his parents earned with a lot of hard work from generation to generation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, and other supplies for the coffee harvest.

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru:
Чынаре 39 лет, воспитывает 4 детей. Чынар в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей продуктами питания, стартовав этот бизнес 9 лет назад с суммы (KGS) 50,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Чынар, ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 8,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынар обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп сахара, муки и мыломоющих средств на перепродажу.  Доходы от кредита Чынар планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность обеспечивать детей и дать им образование.
texts.en:
Chynar is 39 years old and is raising four children. As a source of income for her family, Chynar works with selling food products, after having started this business 9 years ago with an amount of 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Chynar's persistent work, her monthly income is around 8,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Chynar turned to the micro finance organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sugar, flour and detergents for reselling. Chynar plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding the business, in order to be able to support her children and give them an education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour and detergents for reselling

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a married mother who lives in Kisauni. She sells food, assisted by her family. Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to buy vegetables and grains for preparing food. Before, she did not have enough capital to work with, and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments on time.

She always struggles to improve her food stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Esha is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, and chicken.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, and chicken.

loans.name: Las Elegidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ELEGIDAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de café, venta de batidos, elaboración de bordados, venta de plásticos, tejido y trenzado de mantas, ayudante de mecánica, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de chapas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo y deciden establecer su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fierros) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “LAS ELEGIDAS” will begin their second loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. The group is made up of 8 members and is led by a board of directors headed by the president, María Eugenia. The members of the communal bank run various types of businesses including: coffee sales, smoothies sales, embroidery, plastics sales, weaving and braiding blankets, a mechanic's assistant, and a neighborhood shop. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesses. María Eugenia is a member and she mentions that she joined Pro Mujer two loans ago on the invitation of a member of the institution. She currently has a body shop business. She says she learned the business from her husband and they decided to start their own business. 

She is taking out this loan now to increase her capital by purchasing metals from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. Afterwards, she will sell the metal in her shop. This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her home as much as possible as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she likes the health and loan trainings.

loans.use: to buy metal items.

loans.name: Rita

texts.ru:
Рите 44 года, вдова, воспитывает дочь. Рита работает поваром в пансионате и  в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством , стартовав этот бизнес 15 лет назад с суммы (KGS) 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Риты, ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 8,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рита обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для получения доходов от продажи молока.  Доходы от кредита Рита планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, в ближайшее время хочет сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Rita is 44 years old and a widow. She is raising a daughter. Rita works as a cook at a boarding house. As additional income for her family, she works with livestock breeding, after having started this business 15 years ago with an amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Rita's persistent work, her monthly income is around 8,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Rita turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). The loan is for the purchase of livestock, to receive income from selling milk. Rita plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business, and in the near future she would like to refurbish her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Flores De Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLORES DE VENTILLA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sara es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: talleres de tejido, venta de ropa americana, taller de costura, producción de blusas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sara es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cotillones y decoraciones; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en un instituto y posteriormente decide emprender su propio establecimiento.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cotillones) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The FLORES DE VENTILLA communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata center.  It’s made up of eight ladies and directed by a board of directors where Sara serves as president.  The members have different businesses, such as kitting, Amerincan clothing sales, sewing, and blouse making.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Sara’s, who has been with Pro Mujer for two cycles, having joined on her own initiative.  She has a party favor and decoration business and learned this business at an institution.  She later decided to set up her own establishment.

She will use this loan to buy party favors from vendors in La Paz and later sell them in her space.  This work allows her to generate income to support her household; she lives with her husband and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the healthcare training and loans.

loans.use: to buy party favors.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is food vendor at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. Akosua has received a primary education. She is married and has four children with her husband who is a farmer. Akosua has been cooking and selling porridge for breakfast to her community for the past three years after she got married and felt her husband needed her support. To prepare her porridge, she first gets her maize and soaks it in water to soften it for three days. On the third day, she washes the maize and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough out of the milled wet corn and leaves it for a day. She mixes the dough with water to get a porridge-like consistency and cooks it by stirring continuously to prevent it from forming lumps. The porridge only has to cook for a couple of minutes and then it is ready to be served. Corn porridge goes with bread of any kind and fried doughnuts. Akosua is responsible for the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and sugar. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to enable her to acquire a bigger cooking pot.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and sugar.

loans.name: Razhden

texts.en:
Razhden is 49 years old. He lives in the Telavi district with his 44-year-old wife, retired mother, 21-year-old son and 19-year-old daughter-in-law. Razhden requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The main source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows, one calf, a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where fruits and vegetables are grown. Harvested products and the dairy products are sold locally at the markets. Their additional income is from Razhden’s mother’s monthly pension. 

Razhden requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Razhden has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Razhden will purchase a mini-bus. He wants to start trading fruits and vegetables. He will purchase at the wholesale price and resell among the villagers and at the local markets with a price markup. Razhden will be reinvesting the profit in the same business, in order to expand it. This will increase his income and he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru:
Свете 59 лет, воспитала 4 детей. Света в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством , стартовав этот бизнес в 1995 году с суммы (KGS) 4,000 сом, потраченную на закуп семян на посадку картофеля. Благодаря упорному труду Светы, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 1,2 поливной земли с фасолью, картофелем, а  также 1 корова, 2 бычка и 5 овец.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Света обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи, а также покупку ГСМ.  Доходы от кредита Света планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sveta is 59 years old and has raised four children. As a source of income for her family, Sveta works with livestock breeding. She started this business in 1995 with an amount of 4,000 som (KGS), which was used to purchase seeds to sow potatoes. Thanks to Sveta's persistent work, her farm currently consist of 1.2 hectares of irrigated land with beans and potatoes, and further one cow, two bulls and five sheep. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Sveta turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). The loan is for the purchase of livestock for fattening and reselling, and further to purchase fuel and lubricants. Sveta plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Rositas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lorenza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: kiosco de dulces, venta de refrescos, venta de detergentes, tienda de barrio, macramé de mantas, venta de cotillones, venta de cosméticos, venta de ganado, venta de joyas, venta de abarrotes, farmacia.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lorenza es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frescos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de duraznos secos) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The ROSITAS communal bank will begin its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata center.  It’s made up of eight ladies and directed by a board of directors where Lorenza serves as president.  The members have different businesses, such as a candy stand, soft drink sales, detergent sales, a neighborhood store, blankets, party favors, livestock, jewelry, groceries, and a pharmacy.

This loan will benefit their small businesses, including Lorenza’s, who has been with Pro Mujer for two years, having joined on invitation from a promoter who visited her in her home.  She has a business where she sells drinks and says that she learned this business on her own.

She will use the money from this loan to buy dried peaches from vendors in La Paz and later sell them in her space.  This work allows her to generate income to support her household; she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and loans.

loans.use: to buy dried peaches.

loans.name: Bais

texts.ru:
Баис 61 год, имеет 4 детей. Баис в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством , стартовав этот бизнес в 1990 году с суммы (KGS) 1,000 сом, потраченную на закуп 1 теленка. Благодаря упорному труду Баис, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы и 30 овец,  ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Баис обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Баис планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, и планирует помочь внукам оплатить контракт на обучение.
texts.en:
Bais is 61 years old, and has four children. As a source of income for her family, Bais works with livestock breeding. She started this business in 1990 with an amount of 1,000 som (KGS), which she used to purchase a calf. Thanks to Bais' persistent work, her farm currently has two cows and 30 sheep, and her monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Bais turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cattle for fattening and reselling. Bais plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business. She plans to help her grandchildren pay for tuition.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fatteing and reselling

loans.name: Sol Brillante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOL BRILLANTE” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elvira es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta y conservas, tejido de mantas, venta de tunta y chuño (ambos papa deshidratada), venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, tejido de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elvira es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hija que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tunta y chuño (papa deshidratada); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años atrás, con un poco capital que en la actualidad quiere incrementar aún más.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tunta y chuño) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas a su pueblo y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The Sol Brillante community bank will start their 7th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center.  The group is made up of eight members and directed by a board, of which Elvira is the president.  The members work at a variety of businesses, including: fruit and jam sales, blanket weaving, dehydrated potato sales, food sales, cosmetic sales, and knitting sweaters.

The loan they are taking will benefit their small businesses, including Elvira's.  Elvira joined Pro Mujer five months ago at the invitation of her daughter, who is also a member of the institution.  She has a business selling tunta and chuño, which are dehydrated potatoes.  She learned this business on her own many years ago.  She has some capital now but wants to increase it even more.  

The loan they are requesting now is to increase working capital by purchasing dehydrated potatoes.  She will acquire them in nearby communities and later sell them at the markets in the city of El Alto.  This type of work allows her to generate income to maintain her household.  She is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the savings.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of dehydrated potatoes.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es: La Sra. Romelia es una mujer trabajadora, esta casada con el Sr. Manuel llevan ya 25 años de casados, ambos están al cuidado de su nieta. Tienen 23 años en su domicilio; por el tiempo que tienen este se ha ido deteriorando, pero lo que requiere de un cambio urgente es de su instalación eléctrica, ya que han sufrido de bajas de energía, que ha dañado algunos aparatos eléctricos. Esto lo quieren evitar es por eso que piden ayuda por medio de kiva para cambiar el total del cableado eléctrico.
texts.en:
Romelia is a hard-working woman.  She has been married to Manuel for 25 years.  Both of them are taking care of their granddaughter.

They have been in their house for 23 years, and during this time it has deteriorated.  However, what needs to change urgently is the installation of electricity.  This is because they have suffered from energy shortages, which have damaged some electrical appliances.

This is what they want to avoid.  That is why they are asking for help through Kiva in order to completely change the electrical wiring.

loans.use: to re-install electricity.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru:
Айгуль 44 года, воспитывает 3 детей. Айгуль в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и земледелием, стартовав этот бизнес с покупки 3 овец. Благодаря упорному труду Айгуль, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 1,6 поливной земли с фасолью, картофелем, а  также 1 лошадь и 15 овец.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгуль обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 1 лошади, 1 дойной коровы и мелкого скота.  Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, а в ближайшее будущее планирует провести свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Aigul is 44 years old, and raising three children. As a source of income for her family, Aigul works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business with the purchase of three sheep. Thanks to Aigul's persistent work, her farm currently consists of 1.6 hectares of irrigated land with beans and potatoes, and further one horse and 15 sheep.

With an aim to further develop her business, Aigul turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of one horse, one dairy cow, sheep and goats. Aigul plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business, and in the near future she plans to hold her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase one horse, one dairy cow, sheep and goats

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is married and has one child. She has never had any formal education due to her parent’s perception about girl children's education. Juliana hawks and sells cloth in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe Township, which she has done for five years. Her husband is a farmer. Juliana uses her income to pay for the general upkeep of her mother and assist her husband in feeding the home. Juliana will use the loan to purchase varieties of cloth in bulk. With the new profits from her expanded business, Juliana plans to save and reinvest so she can increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of cloth in bulk.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Personas dinámicas y responsables es el  grupo “La Unión Hace La Fuerza”  la cual está constituida  por 06 socios, siendo  Giannina una de las integrantes. Hace más de 01 año que Giannina se dedica a la venta de comida a reparto, esta actividad  surgió con la idea de contar con un negocio propio. Se siente feliz pues con su trabajo y esfuerzo a  podido comprar su terreno y un local en el mercado donde lo alquila, obteniendo un ingreso extra para su hogar. Su último crédito lo destinará   para la compra de insumos como arroz, papa, verduras, entre otros productos. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda. Giannina es casada  y tiene 02 menores hijos. Ella junto al grupo “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” están agradecido con el crédito brindado. Giannina es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo y pantalón verde. Vilma se encuentra en la parte superior al lado derecho.
texts.en:
The La Unión Hace La Fuerza group is made up of six dynamic and responsible members, including Giannina.  Giannina has worked for more than a year selling food.  She started this work with the idea of having her own business.  She feels happy with her work since thanks to her effort she has been able to purchase her land, rent a space in the market, and earn extra income for her household.  

She plans to purchase ingredients such as rice, potatoes, vegetables, and other products with this loan.  Her greatest wish is to finish building her home.  Giannina is married and has two young children.

She and the La Unión Hace La Fuerza group are grateful for the loan provided.  Giannina is the first on the right side, dressed in a green shirt and pants.  Vilma is in the upper part on the right side.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, potatoes, and vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Mariscal Sucre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARISCAL SUCRE” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos de limpieza, venta de helado, tejido de chompas, tienda de ferretería, venta de polainas y chalinas, venta de cosméticos, venta de chompas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda y frial de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne) que adquirirá de las ferias comunales y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The A.C. " Marshall Sucre” will initiate the fourth cycle in “Pro Mujer” (For women), as part of the “Centro Focal de Panamericana”. It is comprised of 9 members and is governed by a board of directors of which Maria is the president.  The members of the community bank work in are diverse areas such as sale of cleaning products, sale of ice cream, fabric for sweaters, hardware stores, sale of scarves, sale of cosmetics, sale of sweaters and sale of food. 

The loan that they requested will benefit small business where Maria is a member.  She said that two years ago when she became a member of “Pro Mujer” her sister-in-law that is a member of the group invited her. Currently, she has a business in her neighborhood.  It is important to know that this business started several years ago from her own initiative. 

The loan that is he requesting is for the increase of capital and purchase of meat purchased from the communal fairs and later commercialize it in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income needed to maintain the household since she is married with 7 children. 

When she is asked what she likes about “Pro Mujer” she responds, “that she likes the trainings in health and credit.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Egam

texts.ru: Эгам пожилой, но активный мужчина в возрасте 50 лет, женат и имеет шестеро детей. В молодости он получил профессиональное образование мастера строительных работ, и долгое время работал строителем. Но когда у него появилась семья и дети, этот вид работы стал для него очень трудным, так как для него это было большой физической нагрузкой. Спустя некоторое время, Эгам со своей женой начали собственный бизнес, который не требует большой физической нагрузки и приносит хороший и стабильный доход. И по сей день он занимается  откармливанием скота. Он имеют небольшую площадь земли рядом со своим домом. На сегодня Эгам имеет в наличии 4 мелко-рогатого скота. Но он не только выращивает и продаёт скот, а также продаёт и молоко, полученное от этого скота. Каждое утро его жена с детьми разносят и продают по 10 литров молока соседям и другим покупателям. Старшие сыновья Эгама находятся на заработках в России  и  каждый месяц по возможности отправляют денежные средства домой своим родителям. Эгам желает, чтобы его дети имели хороший достаток во всём и ни в чём не нуждались. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес, для того, чтобы получать больше дохода. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит в Арванд для увеличения количества скота и объёма своих доходов. Через это он надеется расширить свой бизнес и улучшить качество жизни своей семьи.
texts.en:
Egam is an elderly but active man of the age of 50 years. He is married and has six children. In his youth he received education in carpentry and for a long time he worked as a carpenter. But when he got a family and children, this type of work became very difficult for him, as the work was a physical exertion for him. 

After some time, Egam and his wife started their own business, which does not require hard physical work and brings a good and stable income. To this day Egam works with fattening cattle. He has a small plot of land next to his home. Currently Egam has four sheep and goats. He not only raises and sells livestock, but also sells milk from it. Every morning his wife and children sell 10 liters of milk to the neighbors and other customers. 

Egam's eldest son is in Russia as a migrant worker and every month, when possible, he sends financial support to his parents. Egam wants his children to have a good income and not be in need of anything. He would like to expand his business, in order to receive a larger income. Therefore he would like to get a loan from Arvand, to increase the number of livestock and the size of his income. After that he would like to expand his business and increase the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Klaratsetkin

texts.ru:
Кларацеткин 59 лет, вдова, имеет 2 сыновей. Кларацеткин в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, стартовав этот бизнес с 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кларацеткин, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 3 овец и 3 козы.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кларацеткин обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку мелкого рогатого скота.  Доходы от кредита Кларацеткин планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Klaratsetkin is 59 years old, a widow, and has two sons. As a source of income for her family, Klaratsetkin works with livestock breeding, after having started this business with 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Klaratsetkin's persistent work, her farm currently has three cows, three sheep and three goats. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Klaratsetkin turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep and goats. Klaratsetkin plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil is 38 years old. He lives in Marneuli district with his 28-year-old wife Naiba. Gabil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
The only source of the income for the family is from trading fruits and vegetables. Gabil purchases products from the villagers and brings it to the main market in Marneuli district, where all the products are sold with a price mark up. 

Gabil requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Gabil has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Gabil will purchase a mini-bus. He wants to expand his trading business. With the mini-bus, Gabil will be able to purchase more products to sell. This will significantly increase his profit. Part of the profit he will be reinvested in the same field to purchase more fruits and vegetables and another part will be used for his family's well being.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Susan operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 20 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Susan dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 35 años de edad, es soltera y  tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 4 años de edad respectivamente quienes son su principal motivo de inspiración y esfuerzo diario ya que trabaja para brindarles todo lo que necesitan. Vive junto a ellos en la casa de su madre a lado su padre y su hermana.La actividad que realiza Elizabeth es el alquiler de juegos de videos, para lo cual instaló en su casa un pequeño local contando con todos los permisos y licencias de ley que le permitan desarrollar su actividad.. Se inició hace 1 año con la compra de un televisor y solo 5 juegos que eran los más requeridos en ese entonces, con el tiempo se han ido incrementando sus implementos y ahora tiene 2 televisores cada uno de ellos instalado al dispositivo que permite iniciar el juego.Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso fluido de la clientela a quienes atiende con mucha amabilidad, por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es el desorden que en algunas ocasiones se genera cuando su local esta lleno, espera continuar trabajando y seguir generando sus ingresos económicos ya que tiene planeado establecer otro tipo de negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio , por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará un televisor que usará para seguir trabajando, con el monto restante adquirirá nuevos videojuegos que están siendo solicitados en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old, single, and has two children who are 4 and 14 years old.  They are her main motivation for inspiration and daily strength since she works to give them everything they need.  She lives with them in her mother's house together with her father and sister.  

Elizabeth works renting video games.  She installed a small store in her home along with all the permits and legal licenses that allow her to do that work.  She started a year ago by purchasing a television and only five games, which were the most popular at that time.  With time, she has grown the business and now has two televisions that each have a device installed that allows the game to be played.  The thing she likes about her work is the fluid customer flow, who she attends to with a lot of kindness.  On the other hand, she does not like the disorder that happens sometimes when the store is full.  She hopes to continue working and generating income since she plans to start another type of business.  

Currently she is requesting 3000 soles.  She is very happy to have financial support since she will feel secure moving forward with her business.  She promises again to make her repayments on time.  

She will use the loan to purchase a television that she will use to continue working.  She will also purchase new video games that are being requested in this season.

loans.use: to purchase a television for video games.

loans.name: Juana Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Juana Lucia,
Ella es originaria del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala, tiene 57 años de edad tiene bajo su responsabilidad sus a dos hijos, ella tiene una tienda de venta de ropa, y venta de refacciones.
Desde hace algunos años ella viene vendiendo ropa y también a la venta de refacciones y gracias a dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante.
Gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que el apoyo de ellos a ayudado mucho para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es surtir mas su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias para poder mandar a sus hijos a un mejor colegio para un futuro mejor. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta, y compra de mercaderias para la elaboracion de refacciones
texts.en:
Juana Lucia,

She is originally from the municipality of Tecpan in Guatemala.  She is 57-years-old and she is responsible for her two sons. She has a store where she sells clothing and refreshments.

For a few years now she has been selling clothes and refreshments.  Thanks to God, little by little, she has been able to get ahead.  Thanks to the help of her sons, she continues with the business because their help has been very beneficial.

Her dream is to grow her business and therefore improve her income to be able to send her sons to a better school for a better future. She is requesting a loan to purchase new clothes to sell and purchase merchandise for the sale of refreshments.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing for sale and purchase merchandise for the sale of refreshments

loans.name: Usenbai

texts.ru:
Усенбаю 47 лет, имеет 5 детей. Усенбай в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством, полеводством , стартовав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Усенбая, на данный момент в его хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 20 овец, арендованная земля в 2 га засажена перцем и многолетними травами. Также, Усенбай оказывает услуги чабана.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Усенбай обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 1 лошади, мелкого рогатого скота и селитры.  Доходы от кредита Усенбай планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, и намерен оплачивать обучение старшего сына, который закончил школу.
texts.en:
Usenbai is 47 years old and has five children. As a source of income for his family, Usenbai works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Usenbai's persistent work, his farm currently has two cows, 20 sheep and 2 hectares of rented land planted with peppers and perennial grasses. Further, Usenbai provides shepherd services. 

With an aim to further develop his business, Usenbai turned to the micro finance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of one horse, sheep, goats and nitrates. Usenbai plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding his business, and intents to pay for the education of his eldest son, who has finished school.

loans.use: to purchase one horse, sheep, goats and nitrate

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children, a 6-year-old and a 13-year-old. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for four years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in an open, busy market, and her primary customers are local residents.

Tabitha describes her biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more shoes to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler, selling shoes to retailers and customers in the environs within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will cater for her family's financial needs with the profit she will get from the business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: El Sr. Lelis sigue con la misma actividad de fabricación y   venta de muebles, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de materiales como laminas, en esta ocasión  con el dinero del crédito comprara madera para la fabricación de sus muebles.
texts.en: Lelis continues to make and sell furniture. The previous loan went well, and he used it to buy materials like sheets. This time, with the money from the loan, he will buy wood to make his furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Rafique

texts.en: Ms Rafique is a 44-year-old vigorous, married woman and a mother of three children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. Two of her daughters also assist her in making beautiful patterns. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed in a small garment shop, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Rafique’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 25000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to complete the maximum orders on time. She would like to teach embroidery skills to the girls of her community, so they can help her expand her business and earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Ms Naheed is a 37-year-old woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing and education. She started a business sewing gloves five months ago. While her husband is employed in a small factory, his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone.  Naheed is contentedly doing her business for the sake of her family. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. To increase her sales she needs to purchase a new sewing machine and some more spools of thread so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 25,000. She hopes to get a boost in her net income through her larger sales and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and more spools of threads.

loans.name: Mamiah

texts.en:
Mamiah is living together with her fiancee and four children in the Paynesville area, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 30 years old. Her children are between five and fourteen years old and attend school. 

For the seven years she has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She started this business with a small amount received from her fiancee. She enjoys the profit she makes from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to enlarge her business,

loans.name: Sahira

texts.en: Ms Sahira is a 37-year-old married woman. She is doing a business raising cattle. She has been in this line of work for five years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. Her husband is laborer and his income is not sufficient to fulfill the family needs alone. So she started cattle work and she is very supportive of her family in a productive manner. Sahira has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation.  In order to purchase more sheep and feed, she applied for a loan of Rs 30,000. She has been in association with Kashf for five years. She dreams of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and feed.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a 24-year-old single man who has been working in transportation since a year ago. He is well known in his region for his good reputation and manners. He works on providing transportation services to his region’s citizens, to and from schools and businesses among nearby villages.

Hamza is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance on his van's body.
