Ms. Sughran has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Paksitan to help her husband continue his work. Sughran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this great contribution.

loans.use: To repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Tubumuco Group

texts.fr:
Saidi  fait partie du groupe Tubumuco et  habite à Ngozi. Il a 52 ans et est marié à Amida, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  8 enfants, âgés de  7 à 27 ans, tous  étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  la boutique (riz, savon, sel, sucre…) depuis  3 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de savons, une grande quantité de sel et de sucre,…à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter un véhicule de transport et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Saidi is a part of the Tubumuco group and lives in Ngozi. He is 52 years old and is married to Amida, a shopkeeper. Together they have eight children, aged from 7 to 27 years old; all go to school. 

Saidi has been a selling rice, soap, salt, sugar, etc. for three years in a shop. He is on his second loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a lot of soap and a large quantity of salt and sugar [that he will] resell and earn more. 

In the years to come, he would like to buy a vehicle and see his children [continue to] go to school.

loans.use: to buy a lot of soap, salt, and sugar

loans.name: Manos Unidas Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos residen en el distrito del  Agustino. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “Manos Unidas” una de ellas es la Sra. giovanna   de 31 años de edad madre soltera y con  2 hijos, la Sra. giovanna se dedica ya hace 6  años a la venta de ropa de niños  en un pequeño puesto todos los días,  la Sra. giovanna  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de sus hijos y  de su casa,  En el futuro le gustaría tener una butik propio donde poder vender su ropa de niños y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en una pequeña butik   y así poder tener más ingresos.la sra. giovanna es la tercera de la mano izquierda con polo negro, A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y   diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This group consists of responsible women who engage in different business activities. All of them reside in the District of Agustino and are members of the Communal Bank “Manos Unidas” (Joined Hands).

One of the members is Sra. Giovanna. She is a 31-year-old single mother with two children. For the past six years, Sra. Giovanna has been selling children’s clothes every day from a small vending stall. She says that she has gained the loyalty of her customers and is able to generate income to cover her children’s expenses and those related to her home. In the future, she would like to have her own boutique where she can sell children’s clothes and obtain more income.

With this loan that was issued to her, Giovanna will invest in a small boutique so that she can earn more income. Sra. Giovanna is the third woman on the left (from the group’s perspective) wearing a black shirt. On a parting note, she would like to give Kiva a hug and tell everyone that she plans to accomplish all of her goals.

loans.use: to invest in a small boutique.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 58, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Montano, a farmer, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating a business. They are working hand-in-hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) of jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Helen hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

Note: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money and modified the jeep into a 20-seat jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly Filipino.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. He has one child and has been doing farming for four years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'dairy keeping'.  His biggest challenge is 'drought.' He has not named his animals.

David was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'it funds dairy farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'how to keep records'.

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, David replied, 'it will give them a better quality of life.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. David owns the following: 'cow, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Rosa Martina

texts.es: Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene 8 hijos, vive en el municipio de San Juan Pueblo, junto a sus hijos, nietos y esposo. En su casa tiene establecido su propio negocio desde hace 10 años donde vende variedad de cosméticos como desodorantes, champú, cremas, maquillaje etc. Rosa ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener el negocio, actualmente solicita el noveno préstamo que es por 12,000 Lempiras, para comprar lociones, maquillajes, crema, champú y desodorantes para mantener productos y vender. Su meta es mejorar la calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives with her husband, children, and grandchildren in the town of San Juan Pueblo.

Rosa established her own business at her house 10 years ago. She sells a variety of cosmetics such as deodorants, shampoo, crèmes, makeup, and other items. Rosa has requested several loans in order to maintain her business. She is currently asking for her ninth loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL so that she can buy lotions, makeup, crèmes, shampoo, and deodorants in order to maintain an inventory of products to sell. Her goal is to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy lotions, makeup, crèmes, shampoo, and deodorants.

loans.name: Lisseth María

texts.es:
Lisseth María es una joven de 29 años, casada, madre de cuatro hijos tres de ellos en edad escolar que bajo sus posibilidades ha tratado de dar lo mejor en cuanto a educación y sustento alimenticio.

Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a laborar como profesora de primaria en una comarca ubicada a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce.

 A pesar de lo incómodo del camino para llegar a la escuela ejerce su profesión con esmero y entusiasmo.

Todos los días sale de su casa a las 5 de la mañana en bicicleta hasta cierta parte luego tiene que caminar a pie para llegar a su destino y estar puntual en la escuela, ya que el camino es incómodo y no hay acceso más que a pie.

Con la intensión de obtener un crédito se presentó a Ceprodel ya que sabe que hay unos inversionistas del extranjero llamados Kiva que financian créditos para mejorar el nivel de las personas de escasos recursos.

 Este lo solicita para comprar una lavadora con el fin de ahorrar tiempo y trabajo, ya que su familia es numerosa y le toca una labor de hogar pesada.

Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Lisseth María is 29, married, and the mother of four children. Three of her children are in school, and she has tried to provide them with a good education and nutritional food. For over 10 years, she has been an elementary school teacher in a district located 10 km from the city of El Sauce. Though getting to school is inconvenient, she is an enthusiastic and thoughtful teacher. She leaves her house at 5 a.m., riding her bicycle and then walking because part of the road is only accessible on foot, to reach the school on time.

She has applied to Ceprodel for a loan because she knows that Kiva lenders provide loans to low-income people. She is seeking the loan to buy a washing machine so that she can save time and work. She has a large family, and the household chores are significant. She hopes and trusts in God that these people will support her application so that she can invest.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 32-year-old, married woman, with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She is a teacher and, with her meager salary, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Poor working conditions and low salary are her major challenges while her dream is to build a permanent house for residence and to buy land for farming. 

Mary intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town-dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Edubejes

texts.en:
Edubejes is 50 years old, married, and has five adult children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. She raises hogs, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. She also makes snack foods. She sells Buchi, a rice cake made from sweet rice flour that is molded into shape with a sweet bean paste filling and sesame seed coating and deep fried under high heat before serving. 

Edubejes is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, and sugar for her food selling business. In the future, Edubejes would like to expand her  business to support her family and also to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Rubina Group

texts.en:
Rubina is 38 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband has been running a snooker club for 12 years. The club is located in the central market of the city and has been running very successfully. 

Due to the increase in customers, her husband wants to purchase one more snooker table. Rubina is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to purchase a snooker table for her husband's business.  In this way their monthly income and savings would be increased. Rubina would save the profit amount for the marriage of her daughter. 

Note: In the picture Rubina is raising her hand

loans.use: to purchase a new table for snooker club

loans.name: Jaime De Jesús

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí hay una comarca conocida como Miraflores por su área boscosa y diferentes especies de flores y orquídeas, vive el señor Jaime de Jesús con su esposa y dos hijos al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles su estudios, de profesión, agricultor en granos básicos(maíz y frijoles) y hortalizas(papa, tomate) 

Don Jaime  conocido como una persona honesta y emprendedora, tiene más de veinte años de experiencia y trabajar en el cultivo de papa de una forma semi tecnificada en su finca, que es alta mente productiva y quiere sacarle un buen provecho explotándola en uno de los mejores rubros de la zona

 Hoy en día  el señor Jaime  está solicitando un crédito para cultivar una manzana de papa, donde piensa Salir  beneficiado y comprar insumos como abono, fungicida, insecticida más gastos de mano de obra que se necesitan  durante el proceso de cultivo  y una vez finalizada su cosecha realizar la comercialización y obtener un buen ingreso familiar dándole la oportunidad de mejorar su finca y las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
In Estelí department, there is a district named Miraflores for its forests and different species of flowers and orchids. Jaime de Jesús and his wife live here with their two children, whom they support and educate. Jaime is a farmer, and he grows basic grains (corn and beans) and vegetables (potatoes and tomatoes). Jaime is honest and enterprising. He has over 20 years of experience growing potatoes in a semi-technical way on his land, which is very productive. He would like to take advantage of this and expand it into one of the best plots in the area. 

Jaime is applying for a loan to plant a manzana of potatoes that he believes will be very productive. He wants to buy supplies such as manure, weed killer, and pesticide and to pay the laborers he needs to plant and harvest the crops. He can sell the crops and earn a good income for his family, while improving his land and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed killer, and pesticide for his potato plantings and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing, purlins and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Francisca es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, madre soltera de dos hijos adolescente en edad escolar, como muchas de las mujeres que hay en este poblado que son admirables por criar sola a sus hijos sin depender de un hombre.

 Esta señora ha sido madre y padre a la vez y sin embargo con su trabajo ha tratado de dar lo mejor a sus hijos.

Actualmente se desempeña como Psicóloga en un centro de atención a niños de escasos recursos sobre todo a niños que tienen problemas que han sido maltratados por la sociedad. 

Es un trabajo que realiza con amor y dedicación porque le complace ayudar a estos niños que muchas veces no tienen madre ni padre, les brinda amor como si fueran sus propios hijos.

Con el fin de brindarle mejores condiciones a sus hijos por lo que ella sale fuera del municipio está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para comprar una lavadora y así ahorrar trabajo en el hogar, ya que muchas veces le toca duro por lo que tiene que lavar a mano la ropa sucia del hogar.
Confía en Dios y en los inversionistas de Kiva para que le aprueben su solicitud y llevar a cabo su inversión ya que con su salario no puede adquirir este bien.
texts.en:
Francisca was born in the city of El Sauce. She is the single mother of two teenagers, who are students. Like many mothers in the area, she is to be admired for raising her children on her own. She is mother and father at the same time; nevertheless, she has worked to give her children the best. She is a psychologist in a clinic for low-income children, especially those who have been abused by society. She does her job with love and dedication because she is pleased to be able to help these children, who often have neither a mother or father in their lives. She loves them as if they were her own children. 

She has applied to Ceprodel for a loan to buy a washing machine so that she can improve conditions for her children and save time on household chores, which are often difficult because she has to wash their clothes by hand. She trusts in God and Kiva lenders that her loan will be approved so that she can make this investment, which she can't afford with her wages.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Mwanasiti has owned a food stall business, where neighbors and town-dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge in the fluctuation in the number of clients, hence, unsold perishable goods lead to losses.

With the KES 50,000 loan, Mwanasiti wants to purchase stocks of goods, like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding her business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods, like sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther earns her living by managing a bakery where she sells items such as bread. Her husband works abroad while her children attend school. She doesn't want to rely on his remittances so she went into business on her own. Esther's priority in life is to give her children the best possible life and to help them stay in school through the college level. She is doing her best to make this possible and wants to expand her business by also selling groceries. She is asking for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more of the ingredients she needs to bake bread to sell. She hopes to expand her business to ensure that she can pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake cookies and bread.

loans.name: Muhammadi

texts.en: Muhammad is kind man who is married and the father of three children. He and his family live in a small village where he has worked in the field of animal husbandry for more than nine years. He is trying to develop his business so that his family can enjoy improved living conditions. He is asking for a loan for 4,000 somoni to expand the size of his herd and earn more money. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more cattle.

loans.name: Isrrael Antonio

texts.es: Isrrael de 39 años de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. isrrael solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra asi como sale en la fotografia, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Likeable, hardworking Isrrael is 39 and lives with his wife and four children. He works his own land, where he grows corn and beans. His crops are high quality. After harvest, he sells his crops at different markets close to his home. 

Isrrael has applied a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manure, pesticide, seed, and more for his plantings. He is anxious to increase sales and profits so that he can give his family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticide, seed, and more.

loans.name: Xiomara Aracely

texts.es:
La joven Xiomara Aracely es una mujer trabajadora que reside en el pequeño Municipio de Condega ubicado a unos 35 km al norte de la Ciudad de Estelí, ella es madre soltera y reside en su propia casa de habitación junto a sus dos hijos los cuales están en un colegio de primaria y es ella quien asume sus gastos escolares como personales.

Esta joven trabaja a diario como obrera en la elaboración de puros de tabaco en una fabrica en el casco urbano de Condega.

 Ella tiene mas de 5 años de laborar en dicha empresa, donde a diario desde  las 7 am hasta las 5 pm ella trabaja arduamente para poder llevar el sustento diario a su familia, además ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa de habitación, es una pulpería donde ofrece los vecinos del barrio productos de consumo diario, así ella tiene un sustento adicional para sufragar sus gastos familiares.

Es la tercera ves que esta joven se presenta a Ceprodel a solicitar un financiamiento, en esta ocasión ella solicita un financiamiento para aumentar el inventario que ella ofrece al consumidor en su pequeña pulpería y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos.

Esta joven quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida mejorando sus ingresos mensuales, lo que conseguiría una vez que le otorguen el crédito en Ceprodel.

 En los créditos anteriores ella se a mostrado agradecida ya que el impacto que a tenido los financiamiento anteriores han sido positivos y de una forma u otra han ido mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Hardworking Xiomara Aracely lives in the town of Condega, located about 35 km north of the city of Estelí. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her children, who attend elementary school and for whom she pays educational and personal expenses. For five years, she has worked in a cigar factory in Condega from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. She works very hard to provide for her family. She also has a small business in her home, a grocery shop where she offers neighbors a variety of basic items. The shop brings in additional income to pay household expenses. 
 
This is her third loan cycle with Ceprodel. She is applying for a loan to increase inventory to offer her customers in the shop. This will boost her sales and income. She expects to improve her living conditions and monthly income through the loan from Ceprodel. She is grateful for the previous loans, which were successful and, in one way or another, improved her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy grocery items (oil, sugar, rice, etc.) to stock the small store in her house.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 40-year-old hardworking and independent woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has no children and is currently living with her husband in a rented house. Her husband is jobless, and she is the only person in the family earning money. She works in a dental clinic, but she wants to start her own pharmacy. Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to open a new medical store and to purchase a variety of medicines for that store. She could start her own business and this loan could fulfill her dreams. She hopes and prays that her husband gets a job soon. She is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for a drug store

loans.name: Twungubumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Cladette  fait partie du groupe Twungubumwe II et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 43 ans et est mariée à Daniel, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  9 enfants, âgés de  3 à 23 ans, dont 8 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, riz, huile de palme,…) depuis   7 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz, huile de palme,…)  à revendre pour  gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, elle  voudrait construire  une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Cladette belongs to the Twungubumwe II group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 43 years old and married to Daniel, a driver. They have nine children together, aged from three to 23 years old; eight of the children are studying.

Cladette has been trading products in a shop (beans, rice, palm oil..) for the past seven years.

She is on her third loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan she is being granted, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of items for her shop (beans, rice, palm oil) to resell so that she can earn more money.

In the coming years she would like to build a house and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of articles for her shop (beans, rice, palm oil) to resell and earn more money.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
This is Sharon, 44, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a widow and she doesn’t have any children. She is now living with her niece. Life indeed is hard, but life goes on for her. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Sharon operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Sharon is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages, to expand her product inventory.

Sharon hopes to expand her business and dreams to always have good health.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas
Fray Casiano Puntarenas
2013-56


	Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas presenta la solicitud de crédito de 8 integrantes,  quienes han trabajan en una comunidad de Puntarenas (Fray Casiano) con altos niveles de pobreza. El  grupo de mujeres en la zona mantiene un  ahorro y participan en las actividades grupales para la generación de ingresos.  Tienen 8 años de trabajar en sus actividades, han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.2 de solicitud de crédito del Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas, en esta oportunidad cambia la presidenta, ahora es la señora Herminia, deja el puesto Katia.

	Su trabajo y esfuerzo,  les ha permitido tener su  actividad consolidada como es el  comercio en general (venta de ropa, zapatos, perfumes y otros).  El préstamo va a contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de trabajo de su grupo,  les va a permitir invertir para medio año, incrementando su inventario y cubriendo pedidos para la  época de vacaciones de medio año y día del padre.

	 Realizan la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio del pago a realizar. 

Algunas de ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar, tal es el caso de Herminia, quién se dedica a la venta de comidas en la zona, además de ropa que va a traer a San José y realiza viajes a la frontera con Panamá, es apoyada por su esposo y mantiene una cartera de clientes grande, tiene 52 años y es una mujer trabajado y de respeto en la comunidad. Además de atender sus actividades económicas por las tardes, también ve  a sus hijos y  cumplen con  las reuniones grupales. 

	El objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de sus empresas, obteniendo un financiamiento acorde con sus necesidades y apoyar el desarrollo de la zona  y por su puesto  mejorar la calidad de vida  de las familias. El nombre del grupo las motiva a ser mejores cada día, Mujeres Esforzadas.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas is requesting a loan for eight members who work in the community of Puntarenas (Fray Casiano), which has high levels of poverty.  The group of women in that area maintain savings and participate in group activities to earn income.  They have been doing this work for eight years, they have requested loans before, and they know about group work.  They formed an executive board and are requesting a second loan for Banco Mujer Mujeres Esforzadas.  The president of the board rotates; currently it is Herminia, and Katia just left the post.  

Their work and effort has allowed them to have their consolidated work, which is the sale of clothing, shoes, perfumes, and other items.  The loan will contribute to improving the working conditions of the group.  It will allow them to invest for mid-year, increase their inventory, and cover orders for mid-year vacations and Father's Day.  

They collect money for their repayment weekly, which allows them to have a larger payment margin.  

Some of these women are the heads of their household.  This is the case of Herminia, who works selling food in the area.  She also sells clothing which she brings to San José and makes trips to the Panama border.  She is supported by her husband and she maintains a large customer base.  She is 52 years old and is a hardworking woman who is respected in her community.  In addition to taking care of her work in the afternoon, she also sees her children and attends group meetings.

Their objectives are to improve the conditions of their businesses, obtain a loan that meets their needs and supports development in their area, and improve their families' quality of life.  The name of the group, Strong Women, motivates them to be better every day.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing, sandals, and beauty products.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La joven Karla Patricia es madre soltera de dos niñas en edad escolar, habita en el municipio de El Sauce, desde hace 10 años se dedica a laborar como maestra de educación secundaria en una escuela ubicada en una comarca a 10 km de distancia de dicho municipio donde le toca viajar en bicicleta todos los días para estar puntual en su centro de labores.

Es una mujer admirable que sola ha mantenido todos estos años a sus hijas sin el apoyo del padre, ha mejorado su casa con esfuerzo propio de su salario.

Debido a que se acerca la temporada de invierno y el techo de su casa está en mal estado, necesita un crédito para repararlo, por lo que en este momento está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para llevar acabo su objetivo con el que piensa comprar zinc, clavos y pago de mano de obra.

Pide el apoyo a los inversionistas de Kiva que sabe que son personas de buen corazón que ayudan al mas necesitado, a personas de escasos recursos y confía en Dios que ellos le aprueben su solicitud donde les quedará eternamente agradecida.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia is the single mother of two school-aged little girls. She lives in the municipality of El Sauce, and has been working as a teacher for 10 years. Her school is located in a rural area 10 km from this municipality, where she has to travel by bicycle every day to be on time at her workplace.

She is an admirable woman, who on her own has supported her daughters all these years without the support of the father. She has improved her home through her own efforts with her salary.

Due the fact that the winter season is approaching and the roof of our house is in poor condition, she needs a loan to repair it. So at this time she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to carry out her objective which involves buying sheet metal roofing, nails and paying for labor.

She is requesting the support of the Kiva investors as she knows that they are good-hearted people who help the neediest: low-income people. She trusts in God that they will approve her request, for which she will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal roofing, nails, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is 27 years old and works as a tailor. She has one child and lives in Lahore, Pakistan, where she has run a tailoring business for the last six years. She is well known in her community as an efficient and talented worker, and the stitching she does on dresses is appreciated by all of her customers. She needs to buy a variety of stitching products including thread, needles, and other items but is unable to do this because of a lack of funds. Therefore to cover the cost of buying the things she needs, Kiran has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her increase her income. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials for her business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a fruit and coconuts-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Rositas 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS 25 DE JULIO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de carpintería, elaboración de macramé, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas, tejido de polainas, elaboración de prendas en lana de alpaca, tejido de chompas de lana, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de letreros; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su esposo, ya que antes de casarse ya trabajaban con este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de planchas de fierros) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ROSITAS 25 DE JULIO” will begin its 7th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Los Andes. The bank has eight members, and Susana is the president of its board. The members have various businesses: a carpentry workshop, making macramé, selling fruits, weaving blankets and gaiters, making alpaca wool clothing and sweaters, and running a local store.

This loan benefits micro businesses such as Susana's. She said she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is part of the institution. She now has a business making and selling signs, which she started with her husband. They worked together in the business before they married.

This loan will increase working capital to buy iron sheets from wholesale dealers to make signs to sell. This work generates income to support the family, as she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she mentioned the health center.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets.

loans.name: Luís Israel

texts.es:
Luís Israel es un joven de 33 años, soltero, padre de un niño en edad escolar que bajo sus posibilidades ha tratado de dar lo mejor en cuanto a educación y sustento alimenticio.

Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a laborar como profesor de primaria en una comarca ubicada a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce.

 A pesar de lo incómodo del camino para llegar a la escuela ejerce su profesión con esmero y entusiasmo.

Todos los días sale de su casa a las 5 de la mañana en bicicleta hasta cierta parte luego tiene que caminar a pie para llegar a su destino y estar puntual en la escuela, ya que el camino es incómodo y no hay acceso más que a pie.
Por primera vez se acercó a Ceprodel ya que se dio cuenta que hay unos inversionistas del extranjero que financian créditos sobre todo a las personas de escasos recursos que luchan por salir adelante y en este momento necesita un crédito para realizarse un trabajo dental.

Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Luís Israel, 33, is the single father of a school-age child.  To the extent possible, he has tried to give him the best education and nourishment.

He has worked as an elementary school teacher for 10 years in a region 10 kilometers from the town of El Sauce.  He practices his profession painstakingly and enthusiastically, despite how rough the road to his school is.  Every day he leaves home at 5 in the morning on his bike until he reaches a point at which he has to walk to get to his destination and be on time for school, because the road is rough and there's only foot access.

He approached CEPRODEL for the first time because he realized that there are some investors abroad who finance loans, especially for low-income people who are striving to get ahead.  Currently he needs a loan to have some dental work done.

He hopes and trusts in God that these people support his application so he can carry out his investment.

loans.use: to fix his teeth

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Don Carlos de 47 años de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive junto a sus cinco hijos y su esposa. El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela en donde siembra maíz y maicillo, sus productos son de muy buena calidad y la parcela está ubicada en una zona de fácil acceso lo que es muy bueno para él porque le beneficia que sus clientes puedan llegar inmediatamente hasta el lugar.  Don Carlos solicita un préstamo para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, además de semillas, abonos y poder mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia que es donde siembra. Don Carlos ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y asi darle a sui familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Carlos is 47. He is very friendly and hard-working, and lives with his wife and their five children. He works very hard on his own parcel of land, where he grows corn and sorghum. His crops are of very good quality, and the parcel is located in an area that is easy to access. This is very good for him because it benefits him that his customers can come to the location readily. 

Carlos is requesting a loan so that he can have the money he needs to purchase agricultural supplies such as pest control chemicals and fertilizers, in addition to seeds, manures and so that he can improve the land shown in the photo, which is where he farms. Carlos is anxious to increase his sales so that he can earn more income and this way give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy manures, pesticides, fertilizers and improve his land.

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es: Las Reynas son un grupo solidario que tiene ya 8 ciclos con su crédito. Son mujeres muy responsables, ya se conocen desde hace muchos años. Silvia es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 10 y 12 años, todos son estudiantes. Silvia se dedica a la venta de comidas y el crédito la ayudará para comprar mas artículos para la preparación de las mismas, además de que quiere hacer mas grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Las Reynas is a solidarity group that already has completed eight loan cycles.  They are responsible women who have known each other for many years.

Silvia, 30, is one of the members of the group.  She's married and has three children, ages 8, 10, and 12, all of them students.

Silvia makes a living selling food, and the loan will help her buy more ingredients to prepare food.  She also wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: La señora Manuela es una mujer muy trabajadora pero ha pasado por momentos delicados ya que se encontró mal de salud durante unos meses y la mercancía se le termino y necesita de la ayuda de kiva para volver a comprar mercancía ya que sus clientes mas frecuentes le están solicitando mas ropa para vender. Su esposo trabaja en una maquiladora con un sueldo mínimo y aun que le quiere ayudar a levantar su negocio nuevamente, no le alcanza con su sueldo.
texts.en: Manuela is a hardworking woman but she has had some moments when she has had health issues over a few months.  She is out of merchandise and needs Kiva’s help to buy new merchandise because her most frequent customers are requesting more clothing.  Her husband works in a factory that makes products for export for a minimum salary and now he wants to help her raise the business, but can’t afford to on his salary.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mawuli

texts.en:
Mawuli is married. He has received schooling to the junior high school level. 

Mawuli is a kente weaver in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which he has done for five years now. His wife is a petty trader. Mawuli uses his income for the general upkeep of his home. 

Mawuli will use the loan to purchase different colors of thread, to enable him to weave and sell lots of kente. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to save money, to enable him to employ an assistant.

loans.use: to purchase different colors of thread, to enable him to weave and sell lots of kente.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is food vendor in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe. Charity has received education to the middle school level. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Charity has been cooking and selling food with drinks for the past 25 years to support herself and her husband. She is assisting her husband in providing the basic necessities of their home. Her loan will be used to introduce the sale of drinks. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her old age.

loans.use: to introduce the sale of drinks

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Salama operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Sadress

texts.en: Sadress used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children.She is a 31-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.The responsibility of looking after the family rests solely on her because her husband does not have any sustained employment. She is a teacher, and she has been teaching for six years. Her personal goals are educating her children and setting up an income-generating activity to supplement her income. Sadress intends to use this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is divorced and has 2 children. She has received education through primary school. Patience is a petty trader located at Likpe Bakua, Hohoe, which she has done for 1 year now. Since she is divorced Patience uses her income for all the financial needs of her children and herself. Patience will use the loan to purchase bags of charcoal and cassava dough. With the new profits from her expanded business, Patience plans to save to get enough working capital so shd can do other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal and cassava dough.

loans.name: 6 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE JULIO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isabel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas y mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isabel es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de pasteles; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace cinco años, tiempo que tuvo que ser perseverante para conseguir su clientela.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de heladera) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “6 DE JULIO” Communal Bank will start its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Center. It is composed of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Sra. Isabel is president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses including the sale of food, the sale of vegetables, a neighborhood store, and knitted sweaters and woven blankets.

The funding that they take out will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Isabel. She notes that she became a member of Pro Mujer three loan cycles ago. She was invited to join by a friend who is a member of the association. Currently she has a business where she makes and sells pastries. She reveals that she began this business on her own initiative five years ago and that it took time and perseverance to attract customers.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital (for the purchase of a freezer) and that she will acquire it at the markets in the city of El Alto and later install it at her sales venue. This kind of work enables her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the subject of health.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a 52-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 2 children ages 19 and 22. She has a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like pouches of soy sauce, sugar, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soaps and toiletries. Her husband works as a welder. She has been operating a sari-sari store for almost 5 years now. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional inventory like beverages, shampoo, snack foods and canned goods, to make her store full of items to avoid a shortage of supply. In the future, Crisanta hopes that someday, she could expand her retail store business for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory like soft drinks, beverages, shampoo

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  señora María del Carmen   de 61  años de edad es casada vive con su esposo, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05  años  a la venta de ropa nueva, frescos, churros y paletas.
Doña María su actividad la realiza en su casa y también de forma ambulante, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que la conocen y que pasan por su casa.
Doña María es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de frescos, churros, pan, aguas, mora, leches, etc. está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña María con las ganancias que obtenga por sus ventas espera que  mejore su bienestar ya que tiene varios proyectos para este año y uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
María del Carmen is 61 and married. She lives with her husband, has no children who depend on her, and lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras. She has her own house and for five years has been selling new clothing, fruit drinks, chips and frozen treats.

María works from her home and also door to door. Her customers are friends, and people who know her and pass by her home. Maria is a hard-working woman with the desire to succeed. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit drinks, chips, bread, bottled water, blackberry drink, milk, etc. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. With the income she gets from her sales, Maria hopes she will improve her well-being as she has several projects for this year. One of her dreams is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: To buy fruit drinks, chips, bread, bottled water, blackberry drink, milk, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS BLANCAS” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jenny es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de salteñas y tucumanas, venta de cosméticos, venta de pan, macramé de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jenny es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, por iniciativa propia, ya que siempre quiso tener su negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de queso) que adquirirá de las ferias comunales y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera pero vive con su madre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “ROSAS BLANCAS” (White Roses) will start its 22nd loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Panamericana. The group has eight members, and Jenny is the secretary of its board. The members have a variety of businesses: selling cheeses, prepared foods, and vegetables; running a local store; selling empanadas and sandwiches; selling cosmetics; selling bread; and making crochet blankets.

The loan will benefit micro businesses such as Jenny's. She said she joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of her mother, who belongs to the institution. She opened a cheese business several years ago by herself, as she had always wanted her own business. She will use the loan to buy cheese at local fairs to sell in her store. This work generates money to support her household; she is single and lives with her mother. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she mentioned the access to credit and health services.

loans.use: to buy cheese.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
This is Josefa, 65, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Isidro, a businessman, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household, while operating the business. They both work hard to provide a good future for their whole family.

Josefa operates a furniture-making business. They make different kinds of furniture, like tables, sofas and cabinets, made of bamboo. Customers are sure of the quality of the bamboo set, and it is not too pricey. This product is in demand, especially in provinces. She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales, every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy materials she needs for making furniture, like bamboo, varnish, nails and tools.

Josefa dreams of maintaining the success of their business, and hopes to have a happy family. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the materials she needs for making furniture, like bamboo, varnish, nails and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is married and has seven children. She sells various types of grain, in a market in Hohoe, which she has done for the past five years. Her husband is a farmer. Felicia uses her income to assist her husband with some of the financial needs of the home.

Felicia will use the loan to purchase bags of maize, beans, rice for milling and later for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, beans, and rice for milling and later for resale.

loans.name: Fakhr-Ul-Nisa

texts.en: Fakhr-Ul-Nisa is 39 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. She is a mother of three children. For the past 10 years, her husband has been working as a tailor. He has been running a tailoring shop in the market. Presently he is in need of purchasing a tailoring machine. However, due to the lack of financing, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Fakhr-Ul-Nisa, has asked for a loan amount of 50,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband's business. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive, one for her family and for her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine for her husband's tailoring shop

loans.name: Antonio Alberto

texts.es: Don antonio de 57 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos de 26, 18, 14, 13 y 12 años de edad, Don Antonio se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol cuando ya ha paso su cosecha se de dedica a trabajar de jornal en una casa cerca de su lugar de residencia, el desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas y tambien darle una mejora al terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra en la fotografia, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en:
Don Antonio, 57 years old, is a man who is very responsible about his household obligations because he has always been known to provide the best for his children. Currently he lives with his wife and his children, who are 26, 18, 14, 13 and 12 years of age.

Don Antonio is a farmer who cultivates corn and beans. When his crops are harvested, he works as a day laborer at a house near his residence. He wants to increase his crop sales and thus he is requesting a loan in order to purchase seeds and compost, among other items. He also wants to make improvements to his land. The land he cultivates is shown in the photograph. He wants to continue putting bread on the table in his home. .

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, etc. and to make improvements to his land.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has five kids. Three of her kids still attend school, which is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanasha has been cooking and selling homemade bread, for the past four years. She sells the bread to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges in the business. With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and some cooking oil. Her dream is to see her children get better educations and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and some cooking oil, for making bread

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia, a married mother of two, received education to junior high school. Her husband is an electrician. while Cynthia has been selling provisions in Likpe Bakua, Hohoe for two years now. She helps her husband pay their utility bills.

Cynthia will use this loan to buy a variety of biscuits, candies and sachets of milk powder. She hopes to save the new profits from her expanded business to acquire a provisions shop soon.

loans.use: to buy a variety of biscuits, candies and sachets of milk powder.

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “16 DE JULIO” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, artesanía en disfraces, venta de detergentes, venta de calzados, venta de ollas y artefactos, costura y venta de ropa, kiosco de dulces y galletas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de disfraces; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al trabajar en el taller de su cuñado, posteriormente decide establecer su propio espacio de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de perlas, lentejuelas y tela) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The communal bank “16 DE JULIO” will begin its 10th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Los Andes. The group has eight members, and Lucia is president of its board. The members have various businesses: selling food; making traditional costumes; selling detergents; selling shoes; selling cookware and small appliances; dressmaking and selling clothing; and selling candy and cookies from a kiosk. 

This loan will benefit micro businesses such as Lucia's. She said she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago at the invitation of a friend who belongs to the institution. Lucia has a business making and selling traditional costumes, which she started after working in her brother-in-law's workshop. She later decided to open her own business location. 
 
She will use the loan to buy beads, sequins, and cloth from wholesale dealers so that she can make garments to sell in her shop. This work generates money to support her household; she is a widow with three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she mentioned that she enjoys sharing with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to buy beads, sequins, and cloth.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama sells frozen chicken and fish, at a market in Hohoe. Mama has received none. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a petty trader. Mama has been selling frozen chicken and fish since one year ago. She uses her income to assist with some basic needs of her household, and also those of some extended family members.

Her loan will be used to purchase cartons of frozen chicken and fish. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save, and eventually to acquire a freezer.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of frozen chicken and fish to resell.

loans.name: Merashid

texts.en:
Assisted by her family, Merashid, a married mother who lives in Likoni, sells food. Because she lacked capital, her first loan was very beneficial, enabling her to buy vegetables and grains for preparing food. She has paid the installments on time.

Merashid always works to improve her food stall, striving to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting this loan to buy beans, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, beef and chicken.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Bella Flor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BELLA FLOR”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de mandiles, venta de añelina, trabajo en artesanías, venta de cotillones, costura y venta de ropa, venta de comidas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su vecina que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de añelina (colorante para teñido); cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace veinte años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de añelina) que adquirirá de las personas distribuidoras, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio médico que ofrece.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Bella Flor” (Beautiful Flower) is starting its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Modesta as its president. The members of the Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling aprons, selling coloring agents, making handicrafts, selling party supplies, making and selling clothes, and selling food.

This loan will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Modesta. She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after receiving an invitation from a neighbor who is also part of the organization. Modesta currently has a business of selling “añelina” (a coloring agent used for dyeing). She learned this trade twenty years ago from her mother.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying “añelina”, which she acquires in bulk from distributors. She later sells the product from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to maintain her household. Modesta is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Modesta said that she enjoys the health services that are offered.

loans.use: to buy "añelina” (a coloring agent used for dyeing).

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal nueva esperanza está conformado por 10 integrantes madres solteras mayores de edad, con 25 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona Norte del País. Son personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Pero que por falta de recursos económicos se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Ella lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Meyling es la coordinadora del banco comunal Nueva Esperanza, y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. una pulpería es un pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, azúcar, arroz, aceite, pan, leche, frijoles, detergente, jabón jugos, cuajada. El objetivo del credito es invertir en productos comestible para su pulpería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Nueva Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of 10 members, single adult women with 25 dependent children among them.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country.  They're hardworking and responsible people with a desire for personal self-improvement but who had to work from a young age because they lacked financial resources.  They strive every day to give their children a better future.

Meyling is the coordinator of Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank.  Her job is a "pulpería" located in her home.  A pulpería is a small store that sells food in small quantities, such as small packets of coffee or shampoo, sugar, rice, oil, bread, milk, beans, detergent, soap, juices, and curd.

The goal of the loan is to invest in food products for her store so she can get better income in the near future.

Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva investors give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means for a decent job.

loans.use: to stock her store with food products
